Class ColvinKHash

  • java.lang.Object
    • ColvinKHash

  • public class ColvinKHash
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the postfix expression to calculate a "hash" of a passed in string.
    Since:
    2018-05-02

      • formatString

        public static java.lang.String formatString(java.lang.String str,
                                            int colLength)
        A method that takes a string and formats it according to the column length passed as a second argument. Whitespaces are added based on that second argument.
        Parameters:
        str - String to be formatted
        colLength - Length of formatted string
        Returns:
        Formatted string

      • printTitle

        public static void printTitle(java.lang.String phrase,
                              java.lang.String symbol,
                              int num)
        This method is for handling the visual formatting of a title and a symbol divider placed above and below to create a distinguished.
        Parameters:
        phrase - String to be displayed as title
        symbol - Symbol to act as divider for title
        num - Length or number of symbols to display above and below title

      • peekCodes

        public static int peekCodes()
        Allows for viewing the topmost integer value from the postfix expression stack without removing it.
        Returns:
        Integer value from the top of the postfix expression stack

      • resetCodes

        public static void resetCodes()
        Resets the postfix expressoin stack pointer so that any new values added to stack will overwrite old ones.

      • pushCode

        public static void pushCode(int val)
        Takes the passed in Integer value and adds it to the top of the postfix expression stack.
        Parameters:
        val - Integer value to add to the postfix expression stack

      • pullCode

        public static int pullCode()
        Removes the topmost integer from the postfix expression stack and returns it's value.
        Returns:
        Integer value from the top of the postfix expression stack

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()
        A method for instantiating the array for holding the codes, the stack for maintaining the postfix calculations, and the starting position of the stack: -1.

      • isOperator

        public static java.lang.Boolean isOperator(java.lang.String part)
        This method takes a string and returns if the passed in argument is a valid, basic operation.
        Parameters:
        part - A string to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether part is one of the basic operations

      • evaluate

        public static int evaluate(int num1,
                           int num2,
                           java.lang.String operator)
        Method that takes two numbers and operates on them specified by the operator parameter.
        Parameters:
        num1 - First integer numbers to be operated on
        num2 - Second integer numbers to be operated on
        operator - Operation to execute on the two passed in ASCII numbers
        Returns:
        Value resulting from num1 and num2 being operated on

      • maxValue

        public static int maxValue(java.lang.String[] parts)
        Finds and returns the largest integer value of the string array of ASCII codes passed in as an argument.
        Parameters:
        parts - String array of ASCII codes to be searched through
        Returns:
        Maximum integer value found within string array after parsing
        Since:
        2021-03-28

      • resize

        public static void resize(int arrayLength)
        Stores ASCII code values of inputted string into a new array of length specified by integer parameter.
        Parameters:
        arrayLength - The length of the new array containing the inputted string codes

      • average

        public static void average(int avgDivisor)
        This method divides each ASCII code of inputted string by predetermined number. This method is called when the number of characters in the inputted string is greater than the max indice of the inputted postfix expression.
        Parameters:
        avgDivisor - Number to divide each inputted string codes by

      • KHash

        public static int KHash(java.lang.String s,
                        java.lang.String key)
        A method that turns the characters, of the passed in string, into ASCII codes. The codes are then replaced by the respective indice values contained in the postfix expression parameter "key". The calulations are then executed based on the expression, and the final result is returned.
        Parameters:
        s - Plain text string to be hashed
        key - String containing the postfix expression
        Returns:
        Integer value calculated by running parameter "s" through postfix parameter "key"

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
